title: Lucy Powell: Labour should raise gambling taxes to axe two-child benefit cap
summary: A candidate for deputy leadership has emphasized the importance of the party focusing on the goal of alleviating child poverty. They believe this objective should be made clear and prioritized in the party's agenda. The statement highlights a commitment to addressing social issues affecting children.

title: Matt Beard, former manager of Liverpool Women, dies aged 47
summary: Former Liverpool manager Matt Beard has passed away at the age of 47, according to an announcement from the Women’s Super League club. Beard was known for his contributions to women's football and his leadership role at Liverpool. His death has prompted an outpouring of condolences from the football community.

title: ‘Return to that urgency’: Amorim urges United players to keep winning mentality
summary: Following Manchester United's 2-1 victory over Chelsea at Old Trafford, Ruben Amorim emphasized the importance of maintaining momentum by urging his team to aim for another win in their next match. His call to action highlights the need for continued performance and focus. The win serves as a confidence booster for the players as they look ahead.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: the launch show – as it happened
summary: The ballroom blockbuster returned for 2025, featuring 15 new celebrity contestants paired with professional dancers. Viewers were treated to impressive performances, alongside some that missed the mark. The show's excitement centered around the varying skill levels showcased by the contestants and their partners.

title: ‘We are horrified’: proposed lead mine in NSW wine region has community living in fear for children’s health
summary: Parents are concerned about the safety of their children after it was revealed that the environment watchdog concealed a report on lead mining. The situation raises doubts about the prioritization of public health over mining interests. This revelation has led to calls for increased transparency and accountability from regulatory agencies.
